title: 107_s701
content: The "Rural Heritage Conservation Act" may be cited as the short title. Special limitation for certain charitable contributions of eligible farmers and ranchers is outlined in the act. The "Rural Heritage Conservation Act" introduces a special limitation for charitable contributions of capital gain property by eligible farmers or ranchers. This allows them to deduct the total amount of contributions of such property under certain conditions. The taxpayer's contribution base for a taxable year cannot exceed 100 percent. Contributions of capital gain property are considered after other charitable contributions. Taxpayers can elect to take deductions for specific contributions over a 15-year period. For eligible farmers or ranchers, a taxpayer may make a single irrevocable election regarding their income from farming, which must be at least 51 percent of their total income for the year. The amendments made by this section apply to contributions made in taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act for C corporations with non-publicly traded stock. MODIFICATIONS TO ENCOURAGE CONTRIBUTIONS OF CAPITAL GAIN REAL PROPERTY MADE FOR CONSERVATION PURPOSES. The amendment allows for exclusion from percentage limitation and unlimited carryover for certain conservation contributions of capital gain property under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment excludes certain contributions from percentage limitations and allows for unlimited carryover of capital gain property contributions under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments apply to contributions made in taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. Increase in charitable contribution limit for farmers and ranchers in corporate form. Increase in charitable contribution limit for farmers and ranchers in corporate form. An amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows eligible farmers and ranchers to be treated as individuals for the purpose of qualified conservation contributions. This amendment also includes a conforming amendment regarding corporations. The amendments made by this section apply to donations of qualified conservation contributions made after the enactment of this Act, in taxable years ending after such date. Expansion of estate tax exclusion for land subject to qualified conservation easement under section 2031(c)(8) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Amendments apply to qualified conservation contributions made after the enactment of the Act.
